title: Cloud & DevOps Engineer
subtitle: From October 2024 to today, Sophia Antipolis, France
content: Member of a Platform Engineering team in charge of architecture, deployment, and migration of an enterprise-scale DevOps platform.
OPENSHIFT MIGRATION & MODERNIZATION
<ul class='list-disc list-outside ml-5'>
• Contributed to the technical transition from OpenShift Container Platform 3 to 4 with complete CI/CD pipeline overhaul (Jenkins → GitLab CI/CD).
• Led the migration from Kustomize to standardized Helm Charts integrating organizational conventions and platform tools (PostgreSQL via CloudNativePG, Vault secrets, S3 backups, HPA autoscaling).
• Implemented rootless containers and Kyverno policies for enhanced security.
✨ Impact: migration of 70+ applications with zero service interruption, 70% reduction in deployment time, 20% decrease in attack surface, and 100% adoption of standardized Helm charts by all teams.
PLATFORM ENGINEERING & DEVELOPER EXPERIENCE
<ul class='list-disc list-outside ml-5'>
• Participated in the architecture and deployment of a complete self-service CI/CD platform (GitLab CI/CD, ArgoCD, Nexus, Vault, OpenShift 4) to accelerate time-to-market.
• Created reusable GitLab components enabling developers to deploy to production without pipeline expertise (build, test, lint, security scan, SBOM, registry push).
• Ansible automation for complete provisioning (GitLab repo creation, Nexus configuration, Kubernetes namespaces).

✨ Impact: deployment across 6+ clusters (prod, dev, staging), adoption by 30+ teams, 70% reduction in time-to-deployment (≈3 weeks → 2 days) and 85% reduction in project onboarding time, with near 0% downtime during migration. Trained and supported 50+ developers on platform usage.
AIR-GAP & HIGH-SECURITY DEPLOYMENT
<ul class='list-disc list-outside ml-5'>
• Deployed the complete platform on OpenShift cluster in air-gap mode (no Internet access) with maximum security constraints.
• Configured mirror registries, offline transfer of 300+ container images, and adapted CI/CD pipelines for disconnected environment.

✨ Impact: operational platform maintaining 100% functionality in high-security environment, comprehensive technical documentation (architecture, runbooks), and security compliance validation for sensitive production.
CROSS-FUNCTIONAL CONTRIBUTIONS
<ul class='list-disc list-outside ml-5'>
• Infrastructure as Code and Provisioning (Terraform/Ansible/Outscale).
• Cloud Cost Optimization.
• Per-project monitoring dashboards with alerting.
• Internal SSO interconnection.

✨ Impact: reduced environment setup time by 90% (2-3 days → 30 min), enabled rapid disaster recovery across 6+ automated environments, achieved 20% cloud cost reduction through FinOps automation, and decreased MTTR by 40% via improved monitoring and troubleshooting.

title: International Mobility USA (Internship)
subtitle: From April 2024 to May 2024 at Thuasne USA, Kansas City, USA
content: International assignment to newly acquired US subsidiary by Thuasne for technology assessment, POC validation and Azure Training.
PRODUCTION LINE DIGITALIZATION
<ul class='list-disc list-outside ml-5'>
• Designed a cloud solution to eliminate paper documents on production lines facing the technical constraint of daily variable documents.
• Innovation: 'static-dynamic' QR code architecture (Azure Functions + SharePoint) enabling one-time code printing with content dynamically updatable using a dynamic routing system.

✨ Impact: functional POC demonstrated to operators, complete technical documentation, and validated business case with $12k/year savings (1,200+ color prints/month avoided, 85% reduction in information access time), enabling budget approval and deployment phase planning by the local team.
TRAINING & KNOWLEDGE TRANSFER
<ul class='list-disc list-outside ml-5'>
• Led a knowledge transfer and technology assessment mission following the acquisition of Knitrite under the Thuasne USA banner by the French group.
• Facilitated Azure/IoT workshops (Digital Twin, IoT Hub, Serverless Functions...) to align local teams with the group's cloud standards.
✨ Impact: trained a dozen employees (IT, production, management), documented technological and organizational gaps, provided strategic recommendations for migration to Azure Cloud.

title: Cloud Engineer R&D (Apprenticeship)
subtitle: From September 2021 to September 2024 at Thuasne, Lyon, France
content: Member of the R&D team driving cloud and IoT transformation in the medical devices industry, delivering innovative healthcare solutions on Azure.
DEVELOPMENT OF AN IOT HEALTHCARE CLOUD-NATIVE PLATFORM
<ul class='list-disc list-outside ml-5'>
• Led the migration and improvement of an end-to-end cloud-native platform on Azure for ingestion and management of FHIR-compliant medical IoT data.

• Migration from VPS to a Kubernetes architecture (AKS) orchestrating real-time integration of connected medical devices's data to a secure patient/doctor portal compliant with GDPR/HDS using VueJS and Loopback.
✨ Impact (still in development): pilot platform able to manage 8,000+ IoT devices with 95% availability, aiming to reduce vital data transmission time by 65% and enabling digitalized monitoring.
ML/OCR AUTOMATISATION FOR DIGITALISATION OF CUSTOM-MADE MANUFACTURING FORM
<ul class='list-disc list-outside ml-5'>
• Designed and deployed an automated cloud digitalization solution using Azure Cognitive Services (OCR) to process handwritten orthopedic measurement forms.
• Integration into the custom orthosis production system using a REST API deployed on Kubernetes.

✨ Impact (Proof Of Concept): 250+ forms processed daily with 94% accuracy, reducing manual data entry time by 80% and eliminating 85% of transcription errors, accelerating manufacturing lead time for 15,000+ patients/year.
RECONCILIATION OF MULTI-SOURCES DATA INTO UNIFIED PRODUCT CATALOG
<ul class='list-disc list-outside ml-5'>
• Architected a real-time multi-source data reconciliation system (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MongoDB) to CosmosDB to create the group's first unified item's API.
• Combined use of Azure Durable Functions and Azure Data Factory to orchestrate distributed synchronization of 3 heterogeneous databases across the entire group and its subsidiaries.

✨ Impact: unified catalog of 65,000+ product references with synchronization latency <20min, exposed via REST API consumed by multiple business systems, reducing data inconsistencies by 70% and enabling the launch of a unified product reference API.

title: Software Developer (Internship)
subtitle: From April 2021 to July 2021 at Ciril Group, Lyon, France
content: First professional experience developing a production-ready web scraping application for large-scale retail data collection and mapping.
DESIGN A WEB-SCRAPING APPLICATION
<ul class='list-disc list-outside ml-5'>
• Designed and developed a Python/Scrapy automation solution to collect at scale retail location addresses nationwide, making feasible a project previously impossible to execute manually.
• The application automatically crawls the websites of 25+ retail chains (supermarkets, restaurants) to extract, clean, and normalize geographic data.

✨ Impact: collected 30,000+ addresses with 95% accuracy in a few days vs. several months with manual processing, enabling the deployment of a new geolocation solution for the company's business needs.
